text:
hs. The timing of the interventions 
varied, with three of the four studies which demonstrated evidence of effect commencing 
the intervention in the immediate post-birth period. The remaining study commenced the 
intervention at eight weeks post birth, once women had been screened and identified as 
at risk. There is evidence that debriefing may reduce the incidence of depression at three 
weeks and three months postnatally, but the overall quality of the evidence is very low, both 
studies bei
